name: functions/globals.js
LOG_LEVEL
description:
Determines the level of logging that the function will output. This enables
us to reduce the amount of "noise" generated by a battle-tested function,
whilst enabling us to output additional logging on a new version.

Setting `process.env.LOG_LEVEL` will overwrite the default value of `"info"`
for this variable.

name: AWS_REGION
description:
The AWS Region that this Lambda function is currently executing in.

_Note: This is normally populated by the Lambda execution environment._

name: functions/logger.js
ErrorSerializer
description:
Custom serializer for errors that are thrown by the Error library
that this function utilizes.

name: options
description: The options that the logger is initialised with.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/artifact/artifact.js
readyError
description:
An error was encountered when attempting to download, commit and uncompress
the remote CodePipeline artifact.

name: fetchError
description: The remote artifact could not be retrieved (S3 Error).

name: readError
description:
An error was encountered whilst attempting to read a file from inside the
artifact.

name: decompressionError
description:
The artifact was successfully downloaded, but an error occurred whilst
attempting to decompress it.

name: keyNotFoundError
description: The JSON key does not exist in the file.

name: Artifact
description:
This class handles retrieving CodePipeline artifact files as well as accessing
file contents in addition to attributes defined inside JSON files residing
within the artifact.

As the artifacts passed to the function may reside within remote buckets which
this function does not have sufficient permissions to access, credentials are
used from the initial CodePipeline event object.

params.name: s3Location
params.description: object representing a remote S3 location

params.name: s3Location.bucketName
params.description: the name of the S3 bucket.

params.name: s3Location.objectKey
params.description: the key of the file inside the S3 bucket.

name: id
description: A local ID for this artifact.

name: filename
description:
A filename representing the name of the artifact once downloaded and stored
locally.

name: filepath
description:
A fully resolved Path to the local artifact when downloaded and written
to the `/tmp/` directory.

name: dir
description:
A fully resolved path to the directory storing the decompressed contents
of the remote artifact in the `/tmp` directory.

name: bucketName
description: The name of the S3 bucket which the remote artifact file resides in.

name: objectKey
description: The key for the remote artifact file.

name: secretAccessKey
description: The AWS Secret Access Key which will be used to retrieve the remote artifact.

name: sessionToken
description: The AWS Session Token which will be used to retrieve the remote artifact.

name: accessKeyId
description: The AWS Access Key ID which will be used to retrieve the remote artifact.

name: isReady
description:
Determines if this artifact has been retrieved, decompressed and
written to local file storage.

name: toArtifact
description:
Transform the properties received from CodePipeline into a new instance
of this class.

This function maps the required properties from the CodePipeline invocation
event structure.

return.description: a new artifact file with correctly mapped parameters.

name: toArtifactMapEntry
description: Returns an array which can be used to constuct a Map of artifacts.

name: ready
description:
A utility function to ensure that this artifact has first retrived and
decompressed the remote artifact file, before any attempts are made
to retrieve artifact contents.

name: match
description:
Returns an array of {@link File} instances which represent all matched
files from inside the retrieved, decompressed artifact.

params.name: select
params.description: a linux-style file glob to match files with.

return.description: an array of all matched {@link File} instances.

name: get
description:
Once {@link Artifact#ready} has resolved successfully, this function
can be used to retrieve a specific file's contents from within the
decompressed artifact.

return.description: a utf-8 buffer of the file's contents.

name: attribute
description:
Once {@link Artifact#ready} has resolved successfully, this function
can be used to retrieve the value of a specific property key from within
a JSON file residing inside the decompressed artifact.

return.description: [String] the value of the key from within a JSON file.
true once contents have been successfully decompressed.
true once the file has been written.
the buffer contents of the remote artifacts retrieved from S3.

name: client
description: Returns a new S3 client with credentials pre-configured.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/artifact/file.js
uploadError
description: The JSON key does not exist in the file.

name: File
description: Represents a file inside an artifact.

params.name: path
params.description: the path to the file inside the artifact

params.name: filename
params.description: The name of the file, including the extension name

params.name: data
params.description: A buffer of the files contents.

name: key
description: The S3 key which represents this file (path + filename)

name: data
description: The data contained inside the file

name: upload
description:
Uploads the file to the specific remote S3 bucket, using the supplied
credentials and an optional prefix.

params.name: opts
params.description: An options object

params.name: opts.bucket
params.description: The bucket to upload the file to.

params.name: opts.credentials
params.description: An instantiated AWS.Credentials object.

params.name: opts.prefix
params.description: An optional prefix to apply to this file.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/attribute/attribute.js
artifactParameterError
description: An unsupported parameter value object was encountered.

name: artifactNotFound
description: The defined remote artifact does not exist or access has not been granted.

name: Attribute
description:
Resolves an attribute that has been defined as part of the UserParameters.
An attribute can either be a static, hardcoded value or can be a reference
to a key, found inside a file present in an input artifact.

params.name: mapping
params.description:
a mapping object, either a hardcoded value
 or a reference to a key, found inside a file present in an input artifact.

params.name: artifacts
params.description:
an array of artifacts that any remote
 attribute value could be found inside.

name: mapping
description: Either a hardcoded value (a string) or an object denoting a remote reference.

name: artifacts
description:
An object containing {@link Artifact} instances, with the keys denoting
the logical name of the artifact inside CodePipeline.

name: type
description:
Determine if the type of mapping that has been provided for the attribute
value is either a static value, or needs to be resolved using a remote
input artifact.

return.description: the type of attribute mapping provided

name: value
description:
Resolves the value for the attribute, either returning the static attribute
value, or the resolved value from inside a remote artifact.

params.name: artifactName
params.description: the name of the artifact the file resides in.

params.name: filename
params.description: The name of the JSON file inside the artifact

params.name: key
params.description: The property key inside the JSON file

return.description: the value of the key inside the JSON file, inside the artifact.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/constants.js
FUNCTION_NAME
description:
Retrieves the name of the AWS Lambda function from the Lambda execution
environment variables.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/destination.js
artifactNotFound
description: The defined remote artifact does not exist or access has not been granted.

name: couldNotAssumeRole
description: An error occurred whilst attempting to assume the role that was provided.

name: Destination
description:
This class represents a single, defined destination which the user
has specified inside the UserParameters key.

Responsible for first resolving any source input artifacts and matching
all files found inside the artifact. Then assuming the correct role to
access the destination, and uploading them, using the {@link File#upload}
method.

params.name: destination
params.description: a valid src/destination object.

params.name: destination.roleArn
params.description:
a static or remote reference
 to a IAM Role which has sufficient permissons for the destination S3 Bucket.

params.name: destination.bucket
params.description:
a static or remote reference
 to a destination S3 bucket.

params.name: destination.src
params.description:
An array of source files to be
 found inside one or more input artifacts.

params.name: destination.prefix
params.description:
The prefix to apply to all uploaded
 source files in the destination S3 bucket.

params.name: artifacts
params.description:
An object containing all
 {@link Artifact} instances with the property key being the artifacts name.

name: sts
description:
The AWS STS client used to assume roles inside the lambda function
for the appropriate S3 destination.

name: artifacts
description: An array of {@link Artifact} (which may not be ready).

name: roleArn
description:
A static or remote reference to a IAM Role which has sufficient
permissons for the destination S3 Bucket.

name: bucket
description: A static or remote reference to a destination S3 bucket.

name: sources
description: An array of source files to be found inside one or more input artifacts.

name: prefix
description:
The prefix to apply to all uploaded source files in the
destination S3 bucket.

name: credentials
description:
Retrieves credentials by assuming the defined role, which (should) enable
IAM access to the remote S3 destination.

return.description: an object containing AWS access keys.

name: files
description:
Retrieves all matched file objects from inside the "src" definition.
This function will resolve all matched file references, across all input
artifacts.

return.description: an array of file objects ready for upload.

name: upload
description:
Uploads all matched files from their source input artifacts to the
defined destinations, prefixed with the appropriate key.

Note that this function first assumes the correct role for this destination.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/uploader.js
constructor
description:
Uploads artifacts to a remote S3 bucket defined inside an array of file
globs, of locations inside pipeline input artifacts.

params.name: data
params.description: A CodePipeline data event object.

name: data
description: The data object as received from AWS CodePipeline.

name: parameters
artifacts
description:
An array of {@link Artifact} objects which have been made available to
the CodePipeline action definition.

name: userParameters
description:
Retrieve validated (and defaulted) parameters which have been defined inside
the action in the CodePipeline resource.

return.description: valid parameters to be used to construct the state machine input.

name: destinations
description:
Maps all defined src/dest combinations (from {@link Uploader#userParameters}) to
destination objects ready for upload.

name: perform
description:
Performs the intended operation and uploads source files from pipeine
artifacts to remote S3 locations by assuming the provided roles to
provide the correct permission sets.

The promise resolves successfully after all source files have been uploaded.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/validate/schema.js
remoteAttribute
description:
Defines the schema used to retrieve either statically defined values
or attributes from inside remote artifacts.

name: Schema
description:
This schema defines the keys, properties and valid values that can be included
inside the `UserParameters` key when defining the use of this action inside
CodePipeline.

name: functions/transfer/transfer/validate/validate.js
ajv
description:
Build a new AJV validator isntance, ensuring that all errors are returned
if the data does not match the defined schema and any defined defaults are also
assigned to the returned data.

name: validate
description:
Compiles the raw schema object, providing a method which can be used
to validate against a basic javascript object.

name: validate
description:
Wraps the AJV library to provide a helper function which validates the
passed data object against the imported schema file.

If the schema fails to validate, an array of error messages are generated.

return.description:
a mutated data object, containing any defaulted properties
 where defined in the schema.

name: functions/transfer/transfer.js

content:
# CodePipeline S3 File Transfer Action

This project enables a custom CodePipeline action that allows you to specify files from pipeline artifacts, to be transferred to S3 buckets (see example below). Each transfer must contain a destination bucket, an optional key prefix to apply to all transfers and a source (`src`) key, which defines in a glob fashion the files to be uploaded.

The role provided to each transfer enables fine-grained access control, as the deployed function does not have sufficient permissions. Sample IAM policies are detailed below.

In-order to ensure your Pipeline has necessary permissions to invoke a Lambda function, follow the [setup steps here](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/codepipeline/latest/userguide/actions-invoke-lambda-function.html).

An example action definition inside a CodePipeline CloudFormation resource definition:

```yaml
- Name: Transfer
  Actions:
    - Name: S3
      RunOrder: 1
      InputArtifacts:
        - Name: BuildOutput
        - Name: DeployOutput
      ActionTypeId:
        Category: Invoke
        Owner: AWS
        Version: 1
        Provider: Lambda
      Configuration:
        FunctionName: !ImportValue TransferFunctionName
        UserParameters: !Sub |
          [
            {
              "roleArn": {
                "Fn::GetParam": ["DeployOutput", "Outputs.json", "AssetS3BucketTransferRole"]
              },
              "bucket": {
                "Fn::GetParam": ["DeployOutput", "Outputs.json", "AssetS3Bucket"]
              },
              "prefix": "s3/key/prefix/",
              "src": [
                "BuildOutput::*.js"
              ]
            },
            {
              "roleArn": "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/image-s3-bucket-permissions",
              "bucket": "pre-created-s3-bucket",
              "prefix": "s3/images/prefix/",
              "src": [
                "BuildOutput::images/*"
              ]
            }
          ]
```

An example IAM policy for granting the Transfer function permissions to your assets bucket:

```yaml
AssetS3BucketTransferRole:
  Type: AWS::IAM::Role
  Properties:
    Path: !Sub "/${Name}/"
    AssumeRolePolicyDocument:
      Version: "2012-10-17"
      Statement:
        - Effect: Allow
          Principal:
            AWS: !ImportValue TransferFunctionRoleArn
          Condition:
            StringEquals:
              sts:ExternalId: !ImportValue TransferFunction
          Action: sts:AssumeRole
    Policies:
      - PolicyName: UploadAssetsPermission
        PolicyDocument:
          Version: 2012-10-17
          Statement:
            - Effect: Allow
              Action:
                - s3:PutObject
              Resource:
                - !Sub "${AssetS3Bucket}/*"
```

For a full definition of what you can define inside the `UserParameters` key, see [the JSON Schema file](/functions/transfer/transfer/validate/schema.js).
